00050 // Define PanosContactPoints class
00052 
00053 // Class constructor
00054 PanosContactPoints::PanosContactPoints(ModelPlane * parent) : GroundReaction(parent)
00055 {
00056         XmlRpc::XmlRpcValue list;
00057         int i, j, points;
00058         char paramMsg[25];
00059         double temp[4];
00060         // Read contact points number from parameter server
00061         if(!ros::param::getCached("airframe/contactPtsNo", contactPtsNo)) {ROS_FATAL("Invalid parameters for -/airframe/contactPtsNo- in param server!"); ros::shutdown();}
00062         // Create an appropriately sized matrix to contain contact point information
00063         pointCoords = (double*)malloc(sizeof(double) * contactPtsNo*3); // contact points coordinates in the body frame
00064         materialIndex = (double*)malloc(sizeof(double) * contactPtsNo*1); // contact points material type index
00065 
00066         // Set spring characteristics
00067         kspring = 4570.0;
00068         mspring = 1300.0;
00069         len=0.2;
00070 
00071         // Set coefficient of friction for each material
00072         frictForw[0] = 0.7; frictSide[0] = 0.7;
00073         frictForw[1] = 0.4; frictSide[1] = 0.4;
00074         frictForw[2] = 0.01; frictSide[2] = 1.0;
00075         frictForw[3] = 0.4; frictSide[3] = 0.4; //To update composite to ground firction coefficients!
00076 
00077         // Read contact points location and material from parameter server
00078         for (j = 0; j<contactPtsNo; j++) { //Distribute the data
00079                 sprintf(paramMsg, "airframe/contactPoint%i", j+1);
00080                 if(!ros::param::getCached(paramMsg, list)) {ROS_FATAL("Invalid parameters for -/airframe/contactPoint- in param server!"); ros::shutdown();}
00081                 for (i = 0; i < list.size(); ++i) {
00082                         ROS_ASSERT(list[i].getType() == XmlRpc::XmlRpcValue::TypeDouble);
00083                         temp[i]=list[i];
00084                 }
00085                 pointCoords[j] = temp[0]; // Save body frame contact point coordinates
00086                 pointCoords[j + contactPtsNo] = temp[1];
00087                 pointCoords[j + contactPtsNo*2] = temp[2];
00088                 materialIndex[j] = temp[3]; // And a separate contact point material index array
00089         }
00090 
00091         // Create and initialize spring contraction container
00092         spp = (double*)malloc(sizeof(double) * contactPtsNo);
00093         memset(spp, 0, sizeof(spp));
00094 
00095         // Create and initialize previous spring contraction container
00096         sppprev = (double*)malloc(sizeof(double) * contactPtsNo);
00097         memset(sppprev, 0, sizeof(sppprev));
00098 
00099         contact = false;
00100 
00101         // Create other matrices needed for calculations
00102         cpi_up = (double*)malloc(sizeof(double) * contactPtsNo*3); // upper spring end matrix
00103         cpi_down = (double*)malloc(sizeof(double) * contactPtsNo*3); // lower spring end matrix
00104         spd = (double*)malloc(sizeof(double) * contactPtsNo); // spring contraction speed
00105 }
00106 
00107 // Class destructor
00108 PanosContactPoints::~PanosContactPoints()
00109 {
00110         free(cpi_up);
00111         free(cpi_down);
00112         free(spd);
00113         free(spp);
00114         free(sppprev);
00115         free(pointCoords);
00116         free(materialIndex);
00117 }
00118 
00119 // Wrench calculation function
00120 geometry_msgs::Vector3 PanosContactPoints::getForce()
00121 {
00122         double Reb[9];
00123         double kFLong, kFLat, kFrictionE, kFrictionX, kFrictionY;
00124         int i, j;
00125         contact = false;
00126         safe = true; // NaN protection flag
00127         geometry_msgs::Vector3 Euler;
00128 
00129         geometry_msgs::Quaternion quat = parentObj->states.pose.orientation; // Read vehicle orientation quaternion
00130         quat2rotmtx(quat, Reb); // Construct the rotation matrix
00131         Euler = quat2euler(quat);
00132 
00133         geometry_msgs::Wrench tempE, totalE; 
00134         geometry_msgs::Vector3 dx,we,vpoint,Ve;
00135 
00136         totalE.force.x = 0;
00137         totalE.force.y = 0;
00138         totalE.force.z = 0;
00139         totalE.torque.x = 0;
00140         totalE.torque.y = 0;
00141         totalE.torque.z = 0;
00142 
00143         // Get velocity in the inertial frame
00144         Ve = parentObj->kinematics.posDot;
00145 
00146         // Read vehicle coordinates
00147         uavpos[0]=parentObj->states.pose.position.x;
00148         uavpos[1]=parentObj->states.pose.position.y;
00149         uavpos[2]=parentObj->states.pose.position.z;
00150 
00151         // Rotate contact points coordinates from body frame to earth frame
00152         multi_mtx_mtx_3Xn(Reb,pointCoords,cpi_up,contactPtsNo);
00153 
00154         // Place the spring ends to the contact points positions
00155         for (i=0;i<3;i++)
00156         {
00157                 for (j=0;j<contactPtsNo;j++) {
00158                         cpi_up[contactPtsNo*i+j] += uavpos[i]; // Place upper spring end to contact point
00159                         if (i==2)
00160                                 cpi_up[contactPtsNo*i+j] -= len; //Raise the upper spring end to obtain a visually pleasing result in RViz
00161                         cpi_down[contactPtsNo*i+j]=cpi_up[contactPtsNo*i+j]; // Place lower spring end to contact point
00162                 }
00163         }
00164 
00165         // Rotate body angular speeds to earth frame
00166         we = Reb*parentObj->states.velocity.angular;
00167 
00168         // Main calculations for each contact point
00169         for (i=0;i<contactPtsNo;i++)
00170         {
00171                 cpi_down[i+2*contactPtsNo]+=len; // Place lower spring end "len" below upper spring end
00172                 // Calculate force arm
00173                 dx.x = (cpi_up[i]-uavpos[0]);
00174                 dx.y = (cpi_up[i+contactPtsNo]-uavpos[1]);
00175                 dx.z = (cpi_up[i+2*contactPtsNo]-uavpos[2]);
00176 
00177                 if (cpi_down[i+2*contactPtsNo]>0) // if the lower spring end touches the ground
00178                 {
00179                         cpi_down[i+2*contactPtsNo]=0; // Force lower spring end to stay at ground level
00180                         contact=true;
00181                         spp[i]=len+cpi_up[i+2*contactPtsNo]; // Calculate current spring contraction
00182                         spd[i]=(spp[i]-sppprev[i])/parentObj->dt; // Calculate current spring contraction spreed
00183                         vector3_cross(we,dx, &vpoint); // Contact point Earth-frame speed due to vehicle rotation
00184                         vpoint = Ve+vpoint; // Add vehicle velocity to find total contact point velocity
00185 
00186                         // Calculate spring force. Acts only upon Earth z-axis
00187                         tempE.force.z = -(kspring*spp[i] + mspring*spd[i]);
00188                         // Make spring force negative or zero, as the spring lower end isn't fixed on the ground
00189                         if (tempE.force.z > 0)
00190                                 tempE.force.z = 0;
00193                         int tempIndex = materialIndex[i];
00194                         // Get longitudinal and lateral friction coefficients for this surface
00195                         kFLong = frictForw[tempIndex];
00196                         kFLat = frictSide[tempIndex];
00197 
00198                         if ((parentObj->input[5]>0.9) && (i<3)) { // Apply breaks
00199                                 kFLong = 1.0;
00200                         }
00201 
00202                         // Convert friction coefficients to the Earth frame
00203                         double trackAngle = Euler.z - atan2(vpoint.y, vpoint.x);
00204                         if (i==2) { // Apply steeering
00205                                 trackAngle = trackAngle + parentObj->input[3]*3.14/3.0;
00206                         }
00207 
00208                         // Calculate the magnitude of the friction force in the Earth frame
00209                         double frictionLong = fabs(sqrt(kFLong*(kFLong*cos(trackAngle)*cos(trackAngle)+kFLat*sin(trackAngle)*sin(trackAngle)))*tempE.force.z);
00210                         frictionLong = std::max(frictionLong - 0.01*frictionLong/sqrt(vpoint.x*vpoint.x + vpoint.y*vpoint.y + 0.001), 0.0); //Aply static friction
00211                         frictionLong = frictionLong*cos(trackAngle);
00212 
00213                         double frictionLat = fabs(sqrt(kFLat*(kFLat*sin(trackAngle)*sin(trackAngle)+kFLong*cos(trackAngle)*cos(trackAngle)))*tempE.force.z);
00214                         frictionLat = std::max(frictionLat - 0.01*frictionLat/sqrt(vpoint.x*vpoint.x + vpoint.y*vpoint.y + 0.001), 0.0); //Aply static friction
00215                         frictionLat = frictionLat*sin(trackAngle);
00216 
00217                         tempE.force.x = -frictionLong*cos(Euler.z)-frictionLat*sin(Euler.z);
00218                         tempE.force.y = -frictionLong*sin(Euler.z)+frictionLat*cos(Euler.z);
00219 
00220                         // Add current contact point force contribution to the total
00221                         totalE.force = totalE.force + tempE.force;
00222                         // Calculate current contact point torque
00223                         vector3_cross(dx,tempE.force, &tempE.torque);
00224                         // Add current contact point torque contribution to the total
00225                         totalE.torque = totalE.torque + tempE.torque;
00226 
00227                         if (i==2) {
00228                                 // std::cout << kFrictionLong << ',';
00229                                 // std::cout << trackAngle << ',';
00230                                 // std::cout << kFrictionE << ',';
00231                                 // std::cout << tempE.force.x << ',';
00232                                 // std::cout << tempE.force.y << ',';
00233                                 // // std::cout << tempB.force.z << ',';
00234                                 // std::cout << std::endl;
00235                         }
00236                 }
00237 
00238                 // If there is no ground contact
00239                 else {
00240                         // Set spring contraction to zero
00241                         spp[i] = 0;
00242                         spd[i] = 0;
00243                 }
00244                 sppprev[i] = spp[i];
00245         }
00246 
00247         // Chech for rogue NaN results
00248         if (isnan(totalE.force.x) or isnan(totalE.force.y) or isnan(totalE.force.z)) {
00249                 safe = false; 
00250                 ROS_FATAL("State NAN in PanosGroundReactions force calculation!");
00251                 ros::shutdown();
00252         }
00253 
00254         if (isnan(totalE.torque.x) or isnan(totalE.torque.y) or isnan(totalE.torque.z)) {
00255                 safe = false;
00256                 ROS_FATAL("State NAN in PanosGroundReactions torque calculation!");
00257                 ros::shutdown();
00258         }
00259 
00260         // If there is a ground contact write the resulting wrench
00261         if (contact and safe) {
00262                 wrenchGround.force= Reb/totalE.force;
00263                 wrenchGround.torque= Reb/totalE.torque;
00264         }
00265         // Otherwise there is no wrench created
00266         else {
00267                 wrenchGround.force.x = 0;
00268                 wrenchGround.force.y = 0;
00269                 wrenchGround.force.z = 0;
00270                 wrenchGround.torque.x = 0;
00271                 wrenchGround.torque.y = 0;
00272                 wrenchGround.torque.z = 0;
00273         }
00274 
00275         return wrenchGround.force;
00276 
00277 }

00279 // Dummy torque calculation function
00280 geometry_msgs::Vector3 PanosContactPoints::getTorque()
00281 {
00282         return wrenchGround.torque;
00283 }
